sentence: Recent studies have demonstrated residual activity of mitochondrial function in GBM cells [64–66], suggesting that some of these cells might utilize mitochondrial OxPhos (Fig. 1).

Overall, there are four predominant strategies that could be employed to target tumor metabolism either by depleting extrinsic nutrients from the tumor milieu, preventing the uptake of extrinsic nutrients by tumor cells, blocking the biosynthesis of endogenous metabolites that are essential for cell signaling and tumor growth, or promoting the toxic accumulation of intermediary metabolites (Fig. 2).

The nature of these niches constantly evolves and can be influenced by (epi)genetic alterations, anti-cancer treatments, or additional extrinsic factors such as oxygen or nutrients availability (Fig. 3).
Recent studies have demonstrated residual activity of mitochondrial function in GBM cells [64–66], suggesting that some of these cells might utilize mitochondrial OxPhos (Fig. 1).
